page.title: 10MEAFORD POWER STATION
page.content: Meaford Power station draws its water supply from the river Trent and is situated beside the flood plain.It employs 160 men and generates 240 megawatts of electricity.There are four boilers which burn 25-30 tonnes of pulverised fuel each and generate for 10 hours a day five days a week. There are five cooling towers which dominate the landscape.The "B" station generates the power,the "A" station became obsolete and was demolished.All coal has to be transported into the power station by road.This has caused the road to subside. The Power station has its own private club with licensed bar and function room also sports facilities including bowling green and tennis courts.
